name: Roland Wells

visualDescription.visibleClothing: Well-worn but impeccably clean dark suit with a burgundy tie
visualDescription.condition: Early 60s, balding, with thin wire-rimmed glasses and nervous hands

personality.motivations: Preserving the hotel's reputation, maintaining order, avoiding trouble
personality.fears: Authority figures, being blamed for disasters, losing his position
secrets: He witnessed something unusual the night the Thomas family disappeared
He keeps a secret logbook of unusual guest activities

backstory: Roland has managed the Harbour Point Hotel for over thirty years. His family has worked at the hotel for three generations, and he knows every creaking floorboard and secret passage. Roland was working the night the Thomas family disappeared and was one of the last people to see them. This experience left him permanently anxious, especially around authority figures. He's deeply protective of the hotel's reputation.
currentGoal: Assist guests while monitoring for unusual activities

inventory.name: Master Keyring
inventory.description: A heavy ring with keys to every room in the hotel

inventory.name: Hotel Guest Book
inventory.description: Leather-bound register containing all recent hotel guests

conversationLog.Player: I understand the missing journalist stayed in my room?
conversationLog.Roland: Yes, Ms. Chen was in Room 312. Lovely woman, very inquisitive about the hotel's history and the town. Asked all sorts of questions about the old families—especially the Thomases. I—I shouldn't gossip about guests, of course. Is your room satisfactory?

conversationLog.Player: Did she leave anything behind in the room?
conversationLog.Roland: Sheriff Carter collected her belongings. Standard procedure for... missing persons. Though I believe they missed a few items. Housekeeping found a notebook page under the bed yesterday. I put it in the lost and found behind the desk. I could... retrieve it for you, if you're curious. Sometimes guests like to know the history of their rooms.
